direction.raw_text: .   ANTARCTICA - DAY Snow-covered hills thrust up out of a barren, white wasteland. No buildings, no animals... nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R: The hills are more defined. Rows of jagged peaks and a crazed pattern of crevasses. A fine `mist' of wind-blown snow whips about this jumble of glinting ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R: We track down through valleys, skirt crevasses, climb peaks and finally pause on a flat stretch of ice. HOLD on this scene of timeless, savage beauty, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hooded and goggled in ECW (extreme cold weather gear) drops into frame, smashing down on the icy surface with such brutal impact, the shattered goggle shield pops out -- -- EYES STARE BLANKLY into camera -- locked in death. It's a man. Camera slowly starts to PULL BACK to see his limbs have snapped at unnatural angles, the head grotesquely twisted
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bright red arterial blood seeps from the corpse and spreads out down tiny cracks in the ice until, with startling speed, it turns dark and freezes. We PULL BACK further and look down on the body, a bizarre shape in a spider's web of frozen blood. And SLOWLY WE PULL BACK... further and further...until all is dazzling white.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : WHITEOUT DISSOLVE TO: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The sounds of lapping surf and distant seagulls serenades us like a rhythmic lullaby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on WOMAN'S TOES digging up soft, white sand.    The shadow of a palm tree cascading over top. Widen slightly -- a pair of feminine hands, donning an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ring on the left middle finger, are slowly applying coconut tanning lotion onto firm, athletic calves. Deep. Soothing. Then -- O.C. KNOCK KNOCK on a door. The hands stop. Another KNOCK KNOCK. The lapping surf and seagull sounds come to an abrupt halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Widen to meet CARRIE STETKO, late 20's. Cargo pants -- rolled up, and an exercise top. She's kicking back, but she's not at the beach. In fact, she's in an office, sitting on a chair. A NEWLY OPEN BAG OF KITTY LITTER sits next to a plastic tub she's got her feet in. Two FLOOR LAMPS stand like sentinels above her, blasting her with warm wattage. A fake palm tree casts the shadow across her body. She's pulled the earplugs out of her iPod -- back to the real world. The door opens. Leaning into the room is JAMIE CLARK (20's), African-American. She's dressed in a flannel shirt, jeans. Carrie doesn't look entirely happy at the intrusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jamie leaves. As Carrie gets to her feet, camera moves away from her, panning around the small office. Half-packed up boxes lay strewn about the floor. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A NEWLY OPEN BAG OF KITTY LITTER

dialogue.raw_text: (O.C.) (slightly annoyed) ...Yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, a Professor Sapperstein needs to see you in biology. Said it's urgent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hangs crookedly before a desk. Each day has been marked off with a large X. THREE DAYS REMAIN unmarked. Last space reads: WINTER-OVER, and in the space next to it, there's a cut out picture of a tropical beach. A dart board is next to it with A PHOTOGRAPH pulverized with dart holes over the Bullseye. It's of a candy- striped pole topped with a silver ball, surrounded by international flags - the South Pole. Carrie is standing next to the pole, smiling at the camera, arm-in-arm with
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (30's). Looks like he's handsome, but his face is a little more obliterated than the rest of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An ugly sprawl of prefab buildings, power-lines and above ground sewage pipes. It looks more like a Siberian work camp than Antarctica's largest research base and logistics hub. In the background, smoke rises from Mt. Erebus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :    MCMURDO STATION (USA) POP: 2137   TEMP: -22 An icy wind HOWLS, but the base swarms with PARKA-CLAD FIGURES shuttling supplies and packing up equipment for winter. We PICK UP CARRIE AND FOLLOW her as she strides down the icy, unmade street. Her hood is pulled up and she's not enjoying the cold. She reaches a row of buildings and checks the names - GEOLOGY LAB #2...ASTROPHYSICS -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...until she reaches BIOLOGY BUILDING #7 and pushes through the double doors into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #7 - DAY LONG BENCHES are covered with ANTARCTIC FLORA - MOSSES, LICHENS and LIVERWORTS. They are being nurtured and studied by SCIENTISTS who look like homeless people - unkempt beards, bloodshot eyes and sun-damaged skin. Carrie throws back her hood and unzips her jacket. Approaches one of the scientists with familiarity, who is in the process of EXTRACTING an ICE-CORE SAMPLE from a stainless steel cylinder. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He indicates with a nod to a bench covered with tall grass samples across the room. PROFESSOR SAPPERSTEIN, young, thin and bearded, is studying them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She crosses to him -- CARRIE (cont'd) Sapperstein? He looks at her -- SAPPERSTEIN Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His face tenses -- this is serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leads her to a bench in the corner on which stands a
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Fred, unlock any secrets of the Universe -- discover we're Alien life forms?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Workin' on it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which one's Sapperstein?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Deschampsia Antarctica.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wanted to see me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Follow me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: containing only STALKS and a few HEAT LAMPS. One of the GLASS PANELS has been smashed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks at him -- (CONTINUED) 5.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) They took it all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cannabis Sativa.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He sends an evil glare across the room to four glassy- eyed scientists sitting around a desk, munching on potato chips, candy bars, and drinking beer. Stifling laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carrie looks back to him -- can barely stifle a laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pulls out a small LEATHER FOLD chained around her neck. Opens it up. Puts it in front of his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not sure what she's getting at -- CARRIE (cont'd) C'mon, go ahead, read it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She closes the fold, lets it drop around her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He actually ponders the question for a moment. Carrie puts an arm around his bony shoulder and steers him away from the others. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) My weed, man. I've been growing it all summer and they took it. (BEAT) It was just budding, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (GLARING) It's not funny!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Professor Sapperstein, I'd like you to read something for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) What's this say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carrie Stetko.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep reading.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: United States Marshal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very good. (BEAT) Now are you still sure you want to report the theft of an illegal narcotic?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She pats him on the back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Professor...are you planning on doing the winter-over?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not this year, no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good. And how are you feeling right now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think I'm crazy? Is that what you're saying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, not crazy. But this time of year, down here, we're all going a little toasty aren't we? How about you plant a little Cannabis when you get home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carrie enters. Walks by a mirror. Takes a glance. Is about to fix her hair, then stares at the reflection -- what's the point? We notice a slight scar on her right temple. She steps around the moving boxes to her desk, which is bare except for a thick BINDER labelled,`DAILY REPORTS'. She takes a seat, opens a binder and flips past dozens of empty pages reading "INCIDENT: None. ACTION TAKEN: None." On today's page she fills in the blanks with "Theft of botany sample." And "None." A pencil falls down onto the desk before her. Bounces. Then rolls off. She doesn't even flinch, or look up. Just stares unhappily at the binder. Camera tilts up -- several pencils are stuck into the cardboard tiles. She closes the binder and puts it on the shelf beside a row of framed photos: Carrie in a Marshal's uniform graduation day; crisp, clean uniform. She and two other girlfriends, all smiles, at a bar -- she's got a birthday cake in front of her. Carrie on a beach somewhere, sitting in a chair, feet in the sand -- shaded by a palm. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : As she lifts the frames and moves to pack them in a nearby box -- MURPHY (O.C.) You busy? She turns to see SAM MURPHY, base commander, the guy on the DART BOARD. There's an awkward beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sees the photo on the dart board -- saunters over to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This throws her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes a closer look at the photo -- almost seems amused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her with a smile -- (CONTINUED) 8.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What do you think? (BEAT) I know you weren't in the area. What's up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got a pilot at ASB who thinks he spotted a popsicle out on the ice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What flavor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And we were doing so well. (BEAT) Where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: McClain Valley.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: McClain Valley? What was he doing out there? That's no man's land.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got a plane heading to ASB in an hour with some supplies for Winter-over. (BEAT) Can't get you back until tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You leaving the dart board?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- just the picture.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - ESTABLISHING The red and white striped ceremonial south "pole" stands surrounded by international flags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : South Pole / Amundsen-Scott Station (USA) P opulation: 183                Temperature: - 55 Ice as far as the eye can see. In the background is the base. It's much smaller than McMurdo - a few dozen specialist buildings surrounding four circular buildings raised on hydraulic stands, interconnected by tubular shaped walkways. Off in the distance -- A SNOWCAT mounted with a plow, pushes small drifts of snow off the runway onto a LARGE BERM. It's been busy -- SEVERAL OTHER BERMS flank both sides of the runway. Camera pans to Carrie with a gear bag in tow, as she deplanes a LC-130. A HALF-DOMED HANGAR rises up on the other side of the plane. The main ASB complex is before her. Across the top of the entrance is a huge poster: 3 DAYS TO WINTER-OVER EVAC. Piles of packed equipment are everywhere. Half a dozen NAKED MEN wearing only boots and face masks blow out the front door screaming and yelling, run around the South Pole, right past her, and back into ASB. Carrie heads in -- CARRIE Bottom of the frickin' planet.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: FORGET THE EVE OF EVAC PARTY' --

direction.raw_text: Music cranks. Carrie knows her way. People come and go as she strides along a corridor decorated with PARTY BALLOONS and signs that read: `DON'T FORGET THE EVE OF EVAC PARTY' -- comes to an office door with a small plaque on it that reads: MARSHAL. Pushes it open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carrie enters. It's smaller than her McMurdo office with a HOLDING ROOM that has a viewing window in the door. A fine layer of dust blankets a little desk with a computer and lamp on top. A map of Antarctica is spread across a wall with sub- station positions marked in block letters. A window gives view to the South Pole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carrie opens the door. Single bed. Tiny dresser. No frills. She tosses her gear bag onto the bed. Closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carrie pokes her head in. An examination table, cabinets with drugs and first aid equipment. A couple of hospital beds. Moving boxes are packed up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another door in the back of the room is open, but the light is off. Carrie turns to leave and -- INT.   MAIN CORRIDOR - ASB - CONTINUOUS -- almost bumps right into one of the runners from outside, Aussie RUSSELL KELLER (late 20's) coming down the corridor. He's naked, except for a towel wrapped around his waste. Sports a goatee. Couple tats. Flashes a cocky smile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Doc?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, hello Marshal. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She leaves.    He falls into stride with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keller half smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Keller.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You seen Doc?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Out back.   What are you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Checking the freezer for a popsicle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No shit?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It got called in this morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who spotted it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Delfy, one of the pilots here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's his first year down here. You know how that goes. My bet it was just debris, an old tent or something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah -- probably.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here's an idea -- why don't you stay here with me and we'll party, just the two of us. Put those cuffs of yours to work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Were you the second guy from the front?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not interested. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : (2) They come to the end of the hall.   Keller stops.   Carrie goes right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A large room by base standards. Several windows. A giant map of ANTARCTICA dominates one wall with the International stations and research outposts flagged with pins that have their countries flags on them.   A grid of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of each STATION and OUTPOST is next to it. A Tech is changing a few. Another TECH sits as a console, lined with comm equipment and computers. Others hustle about. Talking into a headset is the Station Manager, RHONDA STEWART (30's). Silky white skin. Irish. Long red hair tied back. Perfunctory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Tech at the console turns to her -- TECH Guys got the science lab all shut down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda sees Carrie coming in the doorway. There's a flash of awkward tension that both mask with professional demeanor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'll have them boomerang back and pick up the load -- just have it ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good, have them check all the pressure levels on the hydraulics, then clear the exterior storage bins. Make sure we're not leaving anything out there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sam told me you'd be coming up -- how's the sleigh ride?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine. I need a plane and that pilot who saw the popsicle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll have him meet you in the hangar. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : A moment of silence lingers as neither have anything else to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carrie leaves.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Selecting a putter from a bag of golf clubs is DOC FURY, 60. Looks seasoned. Bearded. Wears the only non-red parka we've seen: it's royal blue, trimmed with black fur and emblazoned with dozens of emblems and patches from years of Antarctic service.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camera pulls back to REVEAL five NEWBIES (first-timers); an Asian, French, Brazilian, Danish and an American. All are standing on their jackets, shivering uncontrollably in the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doc lines up on a hot pink golf ball and putts. The ball rolls across the glacier in an impossible, wind- driven arc, approaches a flag, and sinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Asian holds a stopwatch.    He stares at it stupidly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In less than three days we begin Winter-over. The sky will go completely black and stay that way for six months.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) The sane ninety percent of the population will be leaving the ice. Extreme weather conditions make it impossible for planes from the outside world to land. You have chosen, for your own misguided reasons, to stay. And it is my responsibility to teach you beakers how not to die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... T... Three minutes. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The class struggles into their jackets. Doc assists those who, in their diminished capacity, are having trouble figuring out how to put them on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carrie walks up.    Doc's eyes brighten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through a disjointed, chattering chorus -- CLASS Hello Marshal Stetko.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Your core body temperatures have fallen to approximately 97 degrees. You are shivering uncontrollably -- losing basic motor skills. You're having trouble focusing on even the simplest tasks. In short, you are well on your way to dying, and it has only been two-hundred seconds. (BEAT) Put your coats on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Your life is dependent on your awareness of the weather. So be aware. There is a condition that arises around here known as a whiteout. Don't get caught in it. Winds kick up snow that's lain on the ice for thousands of years -- can't see six inches in front of your nose. Temperature plummets to triple digits. We found bodies less than a foot from safety and warmth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Class, here we have another of the many hazards found on Antarctica. Say hello to Marshal Stetko.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Always a pleasure to see you. Unlike most of the beaker-heads down here. (BEAT) Social visit?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish -- We got a job. I need you to take a ride with me. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carrie pulls a Driver from Doc's golf bag.    Lines up another pink ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carrie swings -- WHACK!   The ball shatters and pink bits rain down around them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (BEAT) Might be a body out on the ice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why's this crap always happen at the end of the season?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Too cold for driving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carrie and Doc cross the interior, which houses Three double prop Twin Otters, two Snowcats, and six snowmobiles. Keller and two other employees are busy working on one of the Otters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They continue, after a beat -- CARRIE (cont'd) I saw your boxes packed up. What was all that BS last month about, "I'm never going back -- I'll die here. Scatter my ashes over the pole"? He takes a beat -- DOC People change, Carrie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's your gut say about this body?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My gut and I don't talk anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They arrive at one of the Otters.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I got a card from my Granddaughter inviting me to her fifth birthday party. You know, I've never even met her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or mentioned her. A grandchild? Doc, that's great.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It got me thinking -- I need to be a better Grandfather, than I was a father. It's time I deal with my life. I've been down here a lot longer than I probably should have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: a baby-faced, African American pilot leans out the plane's door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delfy smiles graciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delfy disappears back into the plane.    Doc looks to Carrie.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You Delfy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where the hell they get these thumb-suckers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Brooklyn. And unless your wrinkled ass has a heart attack on my plane, I think we'll be all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want Keller. He's my pilot. (BARKS) Keller, get over here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Delfy's taking us, Doc. He's the one who saw the body. C'mon, you'll be fine. I'll even hold your hand if you want. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : (2) She ushers him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The plane soars through a cloudless sky, the sun sparkling brilliantly on the endless ice sheet below. Carrie's in the copilot's seat, wrapped up tight in her
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: just trying to stay warm. Delfy's at the controls. Doc's in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carrie notices a picture of a young boy, around seven, wearing a Yankees cap dangling from the instrument panel. It's framed in popsicle sticks with I LOVE YOU DADDY written around the perimeter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at Carrie, all bundled up. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What were you doing out there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I went to evac a camp. Had to fly off route to get around a storm. Got down low to avoid some turbulence, and there it was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That your son?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, name's Nathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's cute.   Has your eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lucky he got his momma's brain. Kid's smart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So why aren't you with him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The bonus pay. Trying to buy a house. Give my boy a yard. His own room. Stuff I never had.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carrie's eyes drift out the window -- CARRIE We all make stupid mistakes. Delfy tips the nose of the plane down. The ice below is broken by jagged hills and yawning crevasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He spirals down among the icy hills, visibility is poor. Heavy turbulence suddenly jars the plane sideways -- Delfy laughs at Doc's nervous reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He banks the plane and slips down into a valley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a popsicle alright. Down below is the body sprawled on the icy ground next to the crevice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Don't like the cold, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hate it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then why are you down here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's right up here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I don't carry extra panties Doc, so keep it tight. (BEAT) There it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Three o'clock.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Got it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Red jacket.   He's American.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Twin Otter is in the distant background. Carrie, Doc and Delfy, who has a gear bag slung over his shoulder, weave their way around huge ice boulders -- skirt small crevasses. Mid-conversation... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delfy stops.    Grimaces.    Drops the gear bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CORPSE is just ahead -- a frozen display of death. They all stare at it - the body in unnatural angles, the spiderweb of frozen blood. Delfy looks nauseous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delfy slowly shakes his head, no. Carrie moves up to it. Takes a look down the deep crevice four feet away. Can't see the bottom. She walks around to get a look at the face. Blanches slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doc takes a look. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ... It's always different when they freeze. Some curl up. Some stretch out. Some tear their clothes off. They get delirious. What was that guy's name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Linger.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. He's lost in a storm. We can't find him, but we hear him on the radio going on and on about the Serengeti heat and his wife, Janet. Next day, we find him frozen solid, wearing nothing but his bunny boots.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never seen a dead guy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You know him -- CARRIE So do you. Think his name's Weiss. We Wintered-over last year with him. Played cards a couple of times.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The guy who cheated?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carrie lurches forward, holding the line with one arm. Finally, she bumps into something. It moves. It turns to face her. IT'S THE KILLER AGAIN. He swings. She deflects the blow with her free arm, and manages to grab the axe head. The killer tears the axe free, taking Carrie's glove with it. He swings again, but Carrie pulls hard on the rope, throwing him off balance. The axe cuts through the line. The killer hits the ground, and is immediately ushered away in the wind, as Carrie, clinging to the rope, slides over the ice like a pendulum. The line goes tight; she's jerked to a stop. It takes everything she's got to get to her feet. She slowly struggles up the line.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Listen to me -- Forty eight hours ago, we picked up chatter between someone down here and Tahir Soufian, a black market trader in New York. It was all about setting up a buy for cannisters found in an old Russian transport buried in the ice.

dialogue.raw_text: Damn, I knew that government eavesdropping was true.

dialogue.raw_text: There's been rumors for years that the Russians had a second base -- a secret weapons research facility under the ice that supposedly blew up in the late sixties -- nothing was ever confirmed. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) The fact is, before the treaty in `72 they were strip mining all over the place down here -- we believe for uranium and other specialized minerals for weapon's use. It was the Cold War. No one knows half the things the Russian's were up to. This plane could be the link between rumor and truth. And if it is true, what's in those cannisters could be a prelude to another terrorist attack.

This is a very sensitive matter. News travels fast down here, I don't have to tell you that. (BEAT) Besides, I didn't know if I could trust you.

direction.raw_text: and thread, rises and falls with every stitch he makes. Carrie has her attention on BLOODY GAUZE piled up in a tray -- SMASH CUT TO CARRIE'S MEMORY HIT: AN IMAGE SHE SAW EARLIER: The well defined chest of a man wearing a T-shirt. A BULLET HOLE oozes dead center. This time we stay there a little longer, watching the T-shirt absorb the blood around the wound. direction.raw_text: Carrie's bag is open on the bed with the Russian's gun next to it. She's trying to put on a clean flannel over a T-shirt, but can't button it up with only one hand. Her frustration mounts as she fights back every bit of emotion that's trying to get out. She finally gives up -- kicks over a nearby chair that sweeps the stuff off her bed. Bag and gun go flying. Carrie slumps to the floor.    Silent tears. After a beat -- she notices Pryce standing in the doorway with some PAPERS in his hand. He's looking at her compassionately.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We were on a stakeout at a Holiday Inn in Miami, waiting for this buy to go down. I was excited, we'd been after this trafficker for a long time. Thought this bust would be my big chance to impress the brass. Anyway, guy's a no show. One hour went by, then two - - nothing. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pryce takes it all in.   Not the story he expected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carrie shifts in her chair.   Leans forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stands.   Pryce joins her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Then Jack starting acting strange. Next thing I knew my face was being rammed into a mirror. My own partner was trying to kill me. Turns out the whole bust was a set up from the start. Jack was dirty, working with the guy we were after.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Four years together. I knew things about him that his wife didn't even know. (BEAT) But he was my partner and I killed him that night. There's no changing that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Marshall service cleared me -- ruled it self-defense, but I had a real hard time getting over the betrayal -- how little my life meant to a guy I was willing to take a bullet for.
